ygData.subject: Re: New Idea.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hmm, or maybe it is like the trueshot bow quest and it is possible to mkae the actual item...
ygData.messageBody:
Eron Linver wrote:
>
> From: Eron Linver <aeron@...>
>
> There are quests, that involve you saying things to NPCs that aren't in
> brackets. You usually find out this information from other NPC. But it is
> quite common. So it is possible there may be some question you have to ask
> Jogl like "what is a collapsable fishing pole?" or some such thing and they he
> will ask you to bring him a few items (like the jum jum quest) and then he will
> give you the pole. If someone is truely making the poles, then I think this is
> how it is being done.

Hmm, or maybe it is like the trueshot bow quest and it is possible to
mkae the actual item...

>
> As for faction mattering. I know of very few quests that need a faction better
> then dubious (which NPC will usually not talk to you if you are dubious, so
> this suprised me. But since I am dubious with almost all of Norrath,
> indifferent to some, and my pet considers me kindly (I didn't know other NPC
> could do so also). It is pretty unlikely that your faction has to be that
> high. Especially for a quest that involves multiple classes. For the vast
> majority the quests that involve faction being high are quests designed for a
> single class to complete.
>
> Tony Buser wrote:
>
> > From: "Tony Buser" <gr0k@...>
> >
> > Jogle doesn't say anything different to me. One thing I did notice is, if
> > you say "What do you do?" to an important npc, they respond with a message.
> > I ended up going all over steamfont and ak'non saying that to everyone. :)
> > Like Jogl says "I am the master engineer for the Eldritch Collective.." and
> > Zondo says something about him being the Chief Mechanic for the Eld
> > Collective... etc I didn't find out anything important tho.
>
> --Eron
> aeron@...
> -=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
>
> from The Simpsons:
>
> Bart: What do we need church shoes for? Jesus wore sandals.
> Homer: Well, maybe if he had had better arch support, they wouldn't have
> caught'im.
